intro.description: Start a test You are now ready to start testing yourself.

item.title: Start test
item.description: From the menu, choose File->Start test on this module. The Start Test Wizard should appear.

item.title: Test Options
item.description:
Specify what type of test you want to perform. For your first test, Flashcards may be most appropriate. Later, you can try the other types of test.
If you already have lots of Test Items, then you may want to limit the Test to a certain number.
Click Next to continue.

item.title: Select Modules
item.description:
Select Modules Click to select the modules that you would like to be tested on.
After you have run a few tests, you can perform a revision test by selecting test items automatically, but that won't work for your first test.

item.title: Test
item.description: Click Finish to start the actual test.

subitem.label: Try to remember the word in the language which is not shown. (Only applicable if you did not choose Flash-Cards).
Click Show Answer to display the correct answer.
Mark yourself Correct or Wrong according to whether you remembered correctly. It is up to you to be honest with yourself!
The next Test Item will now appear. Repeat this process until you know all the words. Words that you get wrong will be repeated continuously, in a random order, until you remember them all.

item.title: Repeat test
item.description: If you got any items wrong, then a dialog will appear. You can choose to repeat the Test Items that you got wrong first time.
